thread.title: Appeals panel upholds penalties against Bowyer and MWR
thread.title_full: Appeals panel upholds penalties against Bowyer and MWR

title: Appeals panel upholds penalties against Bowyer and MWR
text:
Cheryl Senter Appeals panel upholds penalties against Bowyer and MWR 
A crew member scrapes tires out front of Clint Bowyer's garage during practice for Sunday's NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at New Hampshire Motor Speedway in Loudon, N.H., Saturday, Sept. 26, 2015 (AP Photo/Cheryl Senter) Posted: Wednesday, September 30, 2015 3:02 pm | Updated: 3:30 pm, Wed Sep 30, 2015. Appeals panel upholds penalties against Bowyer and MWR Associated Press | 
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — An appeals committee has upheld penalties against Clint Bowyer and Michael Waltrip Racing that effectively ends any shot Bowyer had at winning the Sprint Cup championship. 
The three-person National Motorsports Appeals Panel on Wednesday ruled NASCAR was correct in penalizing the No. 15 team for an illegally modified part two weeks ago at Chicagoland Speedway.
